did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, European and International Affairs Program (EIA), Office Files of Ruth D. Carter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains the staff subject files of Ruth D. Carter, an Assistant Administrative Officer in the Ford Foundation's European and International Affairs Program (EIA). The EIA was situated within the Foundation's International Division. During the time that Carter worked there, it was headed by Craufurd Goodwin and then, starting in 1977, by Francis Sutton. Carter's records are comprised of chronological files that chiefly originate from between 1968 and 1980.

Materials within the chronological files include correspondence, memos, program data reports and lists, and meeting notes. Many of these records document the EIA's support of projects for arms control and international security as well as the study of different regions and peoples in Europe during the time period.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ruth D. Carter worked as an Assistant Administrative Officer in the Ford Foundation's European and International Affairs Program (EIA). Throughout her many years in that position, she managed a number of shifting responsibilities. These included the appointment and payment of program consultants, reviewing grantee reports, reviewing drafts of Record Grant Action records, tracking balances for all program appropriations, preparing program management budgets, listing all program actions at the end of each fiscal year, and preparing the program control list.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection consists of one series. That series is comprised of chronological files. Documents within those files are arranged in reverse chronological order, so the most recent material is at the front of the files.
Original order was maintained as much as possible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of the chronological files of Ruth D. Carter. Carter created the records through carrying out her different administrative responsibilities in the Ford Foundation's European and International Affairs Program. The correspondence in the files is comprised of letters and memos that were sent between Carter and different EIA program officers, consultants, grantees, support staff, and Program Officers in Charge, Craufurd Goodwin and Francis Sutton. These materials document Carter's duties for reviewing different grant-related records, handling the appointments and payments of program consultants, and compiling and managing different types of data and information for the program.

The Overseas Development Institute (ODI) and the American Council of Learned Societies (ACLS) are amongst some of the grantees that the materials regard. Prominent focus areas of the EIA's grant giving activities during the time that Carter worked as Assistant Administrative Officer include arms control research and the study of different European regions. The series also holds some material regarding the Ford Foundation Paris Field Office which operated from 1970 to 1975. Later records in the series concern the EIA staff's review and discussion of the program's administration as well as possible reorganization of the program.
